intro: Eriocaulon sachalinense, commonly known as the Sakhalin spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Far East of Russia and parts of northeastern China. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and tapering, with a smooth texture. Eriocaulon sachalinense thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies.
